intro: Gitara panamensis, commonly known as the Panama lily, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the Aroid family, which includes plants like taro and philodendrons. The plant is characterized by its large, showy, paddle-shaped leaves and striking, colorful inflorescences. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and swampy areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
